Detailed Description

This class represents the concept of perceptron neuron model.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Flood::Perceptron::Perceptron ( int  newNumberOfInputs  ) 

General constructor. It creates a perceptron object with a given number of inputs. The neuron's free paramameters (bias and synaptic weights) are initialized at random with a normal distribution of mean 0 and standard deviation 1. This constructor also initializes the rest of class members to their default values:

  • Activation function: Hyperbolic tangent.
  • Display: True.

Parameters:
newNumberOfInputs Number of inputs in the neuron.

Definition at line 38 of file Perceptron.cpp.

References activationFunction, display, HyperbolicTangent, initBiasNormal(), initSynapticWeightsNormal(), numberOfInputs, Flood::Vector< Type >::setSize(), and synapticWeights.

Flood::Perceptron::Perceptron ( void   ) 

Default constructor. It creates a perceptron object with zero inputs. The neuron's bias is initialized to zero. This constructor also initializes the rest of class members to their default values:

  • Activation function: Hyperbolic tangent.
  • Display: True.

void Flood::Perceptron::setNumberOfInputs ( int  newNumberOfInputs  ) 

This method sets a new number of inputs in the neuron. The new free paramameters (bias and synaptic weights) are initialized at random with a normal distribution of mean 0 and standard deviation 1.

Parameters:
newNumberOfInputs Number of inputs in the neuton.
